messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...> wrote:
> Alistair A. Israel wrote:

> Are you using the CLASSPATH environment variable for your code and
> tests? If so, don't. Instead, use the <classpath> element inside the
> various Ant tasks (<javac>, <java>, <junit>).

Thanks, Joe.

Nope, I/we have <classpath> elements embedded in our <javac> and
<junit> tasks.

Somebody pointed out the delegating classloader thing
(http://ant.apache.org/faq.html#delegating-classloader) and I'll
probably try that soon (as I can get a handle on custom <taskdefs>)...
but the big question remains: why does it work 'as is' when run from
command-line, but not when Ant is run under Eclipse.

- alistair
